27.0_en:
A couple were taken to hospital after they were recovered from the water

A man has died after his car entered water during Storm Bert. The man, aged in his 80s, was recovered by emergency services from water on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, Colne, where Noyna Ford is located, at about 16:15 GMT on Saturday, Lancashire Police said. He was taken to hospital where he was pronounced dead. A woman, aged in her 80s, was also recovered from the water and remains in hospital where her condition is described as not life threatening.

Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service sent two fire engines to the scene. Firefighters from Nelson and Penwortham who are specialist swift water rescue teams were involved along with a boat from Preston. The man’s death is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be passed to the coroner, police said. Homes and roads have seen some flooding across the UK during heavy rain, particularly in Wales, with more than 100 flood warnings in place across Britain.
• None Body found in search for man missing during Storm Bert

The incident occurred on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, Colne, near Noyna Ford, around 16:15 GMT on Saturday. The woman, also in her 80s, was retrieved from the water and her condition is reportedly stable.

Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service dispatched two fire engines to the scene, with firefighters from Nelson and Penwortham, who specialize in swift water rescue, joining the effort. A boat from Preston was also employed in the rescue mission. The man's death is not considered suspicious, and the case will be handed over to the coroner, according to the police.

Heavy rain across the UK has resulted in flooding in various areas, most notably in Wales, with over 100 flood warnings issued nationwide.

28.0_en:
Manchester City have signed Japan goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita on a three-year deal from INAC Kobe.

It is the first time the 28-year-old has joined a club from outside her home country.

Yamashita said she is "very hungry" and looking forward to the challenge of playing in England's top flight.

"I've won various trophies in Asia, but to level up myself I felt the need to take on a challenge," she added.

"It's a famous club that everyone knows, and even now, it feels unbelievable to me."

Yamashita, who played with City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy, has featured 74 times for her country and has won 17 major honours during her career.

She is the Women's Super League club's third Japanese signing of the transfer window following the arrivals of Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy.
28.1_en:
Manchester City secured the services of Japanese goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita, on a three-year contract, from INAC Kobe.  At 28 years old, this marks Yamashita's first venture outside of Japan. 

She expressed her eagerness for the challenge of English football's top division, stating her ambition to further elevate her game.

Yamashita acknowledged City's global recognition, describing it as "unbelievable" to be a part of the club.

Having previously played with City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy, Yamashita boasts 74 appearances for her national team and 17 significant career trophies.

This acquisition sees City add a third Japanese player to their roster during the transfer window, following the signings of Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy.
28.2_en:
Manchester's City newest addition is Ayaka Yamashita, a 28-year-old Japanese goalkeeper, who has joined the team on a three-year deal from INAC Kobe. This is Yamashita's first move abroad.

Expressing her excitement for the opportunity to play in the English Football League's premier division, Yamashita shared her aspiration to enhance her skills further.

Yamashita was awed by City's worldwide reputation, expressing it as "incredible" to become a member of the renowned club.

With 74 appearances for her country's team and 17 career trophies under her belt, Yamashita previously teamed up with City's midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy.

City's latest acquisition brings the number of Japanese players on their squad to three, following the signings of Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy during the transfer window.
28.3_en:
Ayaka Yamashita, a 28-year-old Japanese goalkeeper, has signed a three-year contract with Manchester City, marking her first move outside of Japan after transferring from INAC Kobe.  She expressed enthusiasm for competing in England's top division and hopes to improve her abilities.  Yamashita considers it an "incredible" honor to join City, praising their global standing.  

Bringing 74 international appearances and 17 trophies to the team, Yamashita previously played with City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy.  This addition increases the number of Japanese players on City's roster to three, including Risa Shimizu (from West Ham United) and Aoba Fujino (from Tokyo Verdy), who were signed earlier in the transfer window.

Yamashita brings significant experience to the team, having made 74 international appearances and won 17 trophies, previously playing alongside City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy.  This signing increases the number of Japanese players on City's roster to three, with Risa Shimizu (previously of West Ham United) and Aoba Fujino (previously of Tokyo Verdy) having joined the team earlier in the transfer window.

29.0_en:
Police have released dramatic footage of officers ramming a scooter rider following a high-speed pursuit.

The dashcam footage shows the Hampshire police vehicle pursuing a black Honda 125cc scooter at speeds of 60mph in a 30mph limit on The Avenue, Southampton.

The 23-year-old rider, who was carrying a pillion passenger, was forced off the bike near The Common where he then fled.

He was arrested a short distance away and was found in possession of cannabis.

After being convicted in court, the rider was fined, given a suspended jail term, and banned from the road for three months.

29.1_en:
A scooter rider, age 23, was pursued by Hampshire police at approximately 60mph on The Avenue in Southampton, despite a 30mph speed limit. The police vehicle's dashcam captured the incident, which shows the rider, who had a passenger, being rammed off his black Honda 125cc scooter near The Common.

The rider subsequently abandoned the scooter and attempted to escape on foot. He was apprehended a short distance away and was found to be in possession of cannabis.

Following a court hearing, the rider was penalized with a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a three-month driving ban.

29.2_en:
A 23-year-old scooter rider was pursued by Hampshire police at approximately 60mph on The Avenue in Southampton, exceeding the 30mph speed limit. Footage captured by the police vehicle's dashcam shows the rider, who had a passenger on a black Honda 125cc scooter, being deliberately forced off the road near The Common.

The rider subsequently left the scooter behind and attempted to flee on foot. However, he was quickly apprehended a short distance away and found in possession of cannabis.

As a result of a court hearing, the rider was penalized with a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a three-month ban from driving.
29.3_en:
A 23-year-old scooter rider, with a passenger on a black Honda 125cc scooter, was chased by Hampshire police at around 60mph on The Avenue in Southampton, despite the 30mph speed limit. In a dashboard camera recording, the rider is seen being intentionally pushed off the road close to The Common.

Following the incident, the rider abandoned the scooter and tried to escape on foot. He was soon caught nearby and discovered to have cannabis on him.

Subsequently, the rider faced a court hearing and received a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a three-month driving ban as punishment.

A 23-year-old rider on a black Honda 125cc scooter, accompanied by a passenger, was pursued by Hampshire police at approximately 60mph on The Avenue in Southampton, despite the posted speed limit of 30mph. In a dashboard camera recording, the rider is depicted being deliberately maneuvered off the road close to The Common.

After the occurrence, the rider forsake the scooter and attempted to elude capture on foot. He was apprehended in the vicinity and found to possess cannabis.

As a result, the rider attended a court hearing and was penalized with a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a three-month driving prohibition.

Dashboard camera footage shows the rider being forced off the road near The Common. Following the incident, the rider abandoned the scooter and ran but was caught nearby and found to be carrying cannabis. Consequently, the rider faced court and was given a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a three-month ban from driving.

In dashboard camera footage, the rider is seen being pushed off the road close to The Common. Post-incident, the rider deserted the scooter and fled, only to be apprehended nearby. Upon his capture, cannabis was discovered on him. Subsequently, the rider was summoned to court and penalized with a fine, a suspended prison term, and a three-month driving prohibition.
